And when he had called unto <FI>him<Fi> his twelve disciples, he gave them power <FI>against<Fi> unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal all manner of sickness and all manner of disease.<RF>against: or, over<Rf>
Now the names of the twelve apostles are these; The first, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother; James <FI>the son<Fi> of Zebedee, and John his brother;
Philip, and Bartholomew; Thomas, and Matthew the publican; James <FI>the son<Fi> of Alphaeus, and Lebbaeus, whose surname was Thaddaeus;
Simon the Canaanite, and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.<CM>
These twelve Jesus sent forth, and commanded them, saying, <FR>Go not into the way of the Gentiles, and into <FI>any<Fi> city of the Samaritans enter ye not:<Fr>
<FR>But go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.<Fr>
<FR>And as ye go, preach, saying, The kingdom of heaven is at hand.<Fr>
<FR>Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers, raise the dead, cast out devils: freely ye have received, freely give.<Fr>
<FR>Provide neither gold, nor silver, nor brass in your purses,<Fr><RF>Provide: or, Get<Rf>
<FR>Nor scrip for <FI>your<Fi> journey, neither two coats, neither shoes, nor yet staves: for the workman is worthy of his meat.<Fr><RF>staves: Gr. a staff<Rf>
<FR>And into whatsoever city or town ye shall enter, enquire who in it is worthy; and there abide till ye go thence.<Fr>
<FR>And when ye come into an house, salute it.<Fr>
<FR>And if the house be worthy, let your peace come upon it: but if it be not worthy, let your peace return to you.<Fr>
<FR>And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear your words, when ye depart out of that house or city, shake off the dust of your feet.<Fr>
<FR>Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment, than for that city.<Fr><CM>
<FR>Behold, I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves: be ye therefore wise as serpents, and harmless as doves.<Fr><RF>harmless: or, simple<Rf>
<FR>But beware of men: for they will deliver you up to the councils, and they will scourge you in their synagogues;<Fr>
<FR>And ye shall be brought before governors and kings for my sake, for a testimony against them and the Gentiles.<Fr>
<FR>But when they deliver you up, take no thought how or what ye shall speak: for it shall be given you in that same hour what ye shall speak.<Fr>
<FR>For it is not ye that speak, but the Spirit of your Father which speaketh in you.<Fr>
<FR>And the brother shall deliver up the brother to death, and the father the child: and the children shall rise up against <FI>their<Fi> parents, and cause them to be put to death.<Fr>
<FR>And ye shall be hated of all <FI>men<Fi> for my name's sake: but he that endureth to the end shall be saved.<Fr>

<FR>But when they persecute you in this city, flee ye into another: for verily I say unto you, Ye shall not have gone over the cities of Israel, till the Son of man be come.<Fr><RF>haveâ€¦: or, end, or, finish<Rf>
<FR>The disciple is not above <FI>his<Fi> master, nor the servant above his lord.<Fr>

<FR>It is enough for the disciple that he be as his master, and the servant as his lord. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub, how much more <FI>shall they call<Fi> them of his household?<Fr><RF>Beelzebub: Gr. Beelzebul<Rf>
<FR>Fear them not therefore: for there is nothing covered, that shall not be revealed; and hid, that shall not be known.<Fr>
<FR>What I tell you in darkness, <FI>that<Fi> speak ye in light: and what ye hear in the ear, <FI>that<Fi> preach ye upon the housetops.<Fr>
<FR>And fear not them which kill the body, but are not able to kill the soul: but rather fear him which is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.<Fr>

<FR>Are not two sparrows sold for a farthing? and one of them shall not fall on the ground without your Father.<Fr><RF>farthing: it is in value halfpenny farthing in the original, as being the tenth part of the Roman penny<Rf>
<FR>But the very hairs of your head are all numbered.<Fr>
<FR>Fear ye not therefore, ye are of more value than many sparrows.<Fr>
<FR>Whosoever therefore shall confess me before men, him will I confess also before my Father which is in heaven.<Fr>
<FR>But whosoever shall deny me before men, him will I also deny before my Father which is in heaven.<Fr>
<FR>Think not that I am come to send peace on earth: I came not to send peace, but a sword.<Fr>
<FR><FO>For I am come to set a man at variance against his father, and the daughter against her mother, and the daughter in law against her mother in law.<Fo><Fr>
<FR><FO>And a man's foes <FI>shall be<Fi> they of his own household.<Fo><Fr>
<FR>He that loveth father or mother more than me is not worthy of me: and he that loveth son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me.<Fr>
<FR>And he that taketh not his cross, and followeth after me, is not worthy of me.<Fr>
<FR>He that findeth his life shall lose it: and he that loseth his life for my sake shall find it.<Fr>
<FR>He that receiveth you receiveth me, and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me.<Fr>

<FR>He that receiveth a prophet in the name of a prophet shall receive a prophet's reward; and he that receiveth a righteous man in the name of a righteous man shall receive a righteous man's reward.<Fr>
<FR>And whosoever shall give to drink unto one of these little ones a cup of cold <FI>water<Fi> only in the name of a disciple, verily I say unto you, he shall in no wise lose his reward.<Fr><CM>
